Daily Discussion 210/784

embeds.title: Moment of Truth
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

**Retain**.
Draw 1 (2) card (cards).
:finisher:   **Finisher**

messages.content: One of the Champ's few draw cards
so insanely useful
finisher on demand
Could use new art, but the beta art is totally amazing
The #1 champ utility card. It's draw, block, strength, it retains, it does it all

This is a very useful utility card. It can give you block or strength depending on what stance you were in, it's a 0 cost skill cheaply proccing your stance bonuses, it retains, which lets you wait for an opportune moment to get extra block. It you upgrade it, it becomes draw positive (fairly high priority upgrade), on a character with very little access to card draw. The sheer flexibility of the card is very strong, it's capable of performing all kinds of roles, and will often be able to help fill in the gaps to play a turn correctly against the enemies intent, especially if you have good access to both stances.

As a finisher, it is somewhat in competition with the other finishers, though most of them specialize in dealing burst damage. Your deck can really only afford to have so many finishers in it, or they risk being dead cards, though this having retain means that you can still get value out of it later. Just make sure you are drafting stance entries higher if you are picking this card up, and especially once you have 4+ finishers in one deck.

This is mostly a late game card, where the utility and card draw will be more valuable. You probably don't want to be taking this until clearing the act 1 elites, it's fine against lagavulin, but bad against tri-sentries and nob. If you have enough access to defensive stance, this will be pretty solid in short hallway fights as well, but usually you shouldn't be taking it until late act 1 or early act 2. Gets better with ink bottle and letter opener. I could see this getting a nerf of some kind, it stands out as pretty powerful right now. I don't think making this cost 1 energy would be ridiculous.
Champs single best card

This card breaks ultimate stance more then any other card, makes finisher card spam feasible  (it makes devastate and dancing master pickable all), can create infinites fairly easily and provides significant block for every run

you would need to already have 3 of these to make picking a 4th copy feel less then ideal (and even then 4 copes can totally be fine). retain lets you take this in act one with no problems, as it lets you use it with defensive stance every time vs sentries and lagavunlin and ageist nob you only draw it once making it far less bad then other skills.
really the only card that comes close to this is <ignore pain>, which is just a 2 cost apparition

embeds.title: Ignore Pain
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 2 (1) :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Your HP cannot be reduced until your next turn.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: <cheap shot>

embeds.title: Cheap Shot
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 2 (1) :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 5 damage.
If the enemy is a Boss, deal damage two more times. If not, **Stun** it.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: a top 3 champ card, I'd say
nah cheap shot is bad into act 4, its merely the third most broken champ card because of this.
lol just simply don't play act 4
also ignore pain is better into group fights then cheap shot
although they both often act as 2 cost make the enemy do nothing cards
cheap shot works better against non-attacks. Champ has pretty bad draw, so you can sometimes draw ignore pain during a debuff turn and its a dead draw.
cheap shot is partially wasted if the enemy isnt attacking; regardless its perfectly fine to just shuffle the cards back in to use later in the fight.
no? It just means the enemy will debuff next turn.
yes but your cheap shot exhausts so you miss the chance to block damage with it instead; not that it matters every fight
and that downside doesn't matter at all when you have more then one cheap shot because stun stacks
it still means you'll be attacked 1 less time that combat, whether you use it turn 1 or turn 50.
in a hypothetical fight, if an enemy debuffs for the first 4 turns and attacks from the 5th (like head if it only debuffed)
whether you play cheap shot turn 1, or on turn 5, you won't be attacked until turn 6
yes but blocking something like giant head's big attack means much more then blocking its weak
3 hit attack isn't even bad in act 4 tbh
champ lacks multihits a lot to balance easy vigor
and built in strength scaling too
but you don't block it, you just push it back a turn. It still will happen.
ya but pushing it back a turn means your not taking 40 damage right away letting you play more attacks and possibly just win the fight before it comes out
yes and it doesn't matter when you push it back in this situation, as long as you do push it back.

champ doesn't have many sources of card draw, but they are at least all good cards. Refreshment is great, rope a dope sets up lethal every fight, circumvent is easy to obtain and use. Dancing master isnt even bad because of moment of truth making procing it easy. Really the only bad card draw champ has is crownarang and even that card is still useable.
<rope a dope>
champ also has multiple ways to add more random cards directly into your hand

embeds.title: Rope-a-dope
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 2 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Gain 12 **Block** :p_block:.
Next turn, gain :energy_champ:  ( :energy_champ:) and draw 2 cards.
:finisher:   **Finisher**

messages.content: Champ still has way below average draw, and no way to thin the deck down either, and a pretty low amount of card manipulation (only <headbutt champ>)

embeds.title: Headbutt
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Deal 9 (12) damage.
Put a card from your discard pile on top of your draw pile.

messages.content: <wind up> lets you search out finishers

embeds.title: Wind Up
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 0 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Choose a **Stance** to Enter.
**Fetch** a **Finisher** from your draw pile.
​~~- **Exhaust**. -~~

messages.content: every other character except maybe hermit (maybe gremlins? idk I haven't played them in months) has better draw
and even if in pure numbers they might not be, they have ways to thin down the deck
and also literally every draw card is strong in part because of such scarcity in draw (obviously there are some that just are broken)

Most bosses have less card draw then the base game though. slime boss and hexaghost have only a couple of draw cards ether. Slime boss is mostly relying on spear tackle and hexaghosts pure draw cards all have drawbacks (and theres still not that many of them). Guardian only has a little bit more card draw then champ (and its card draw is much worse then what champ has). Gremlins have the least raw card draw, automation has a solid amount and snecko has a ton.
grems has horrible draw
it's like raid and tricksy for real draw iirc
<?gremlins draw>

messages.content: oh yeah enthusiasm helps too
idk if tricksy would count, its mostly just enthusiasm, raid and fairy dust.
fairy dust is one-time though
i guess gremlin dance with sneaky up
pinprick+ ... kind of?
It's pretty awkward though
rhythm lets you search gremlin dance so that's like half a draw

slime boss has licks and multiple lick recursion cards. Hexa has a ton of ethereal so it has less cards in your deck to cycle through. Guardian has stasis so you will often have a lot of cards in hand anyway. Auto has pretty bad draw (only notable ones off the top of my head are cut through fate encode version, bug barrage, go-to, the power that draws 3 for 0 cost for some reason, and robochop) but has anti-status/curse stuff so getting your draws eaten is less likely, and encoded cards are like drawing 3 cards together (and only paying for 1).
hermit draw was like, ok-ish, it's mostly carried by fatal desire and luck of the draw and gets screwed if you're running dead on deck since those don't work nearly as well if it's not a curse deck
there's stuff like vantage quickdraw overwhelming power i guess but other than vantage it's mostly just for burst
all these characters might not pure draw, but they have alternatives that do a similar thing (help with consistently having good cards in hand)
combo is really awkward because it shoves the dead-on card back into your hand where it can't be played lol
for dead on anyway
champs cards do that well enough though. Consider that champ has a lot of exhausting cards too and doesn't need to take that many attacks
like champ can just take 2 "real" attacks and be completely fine for the whole game, cutting down on your deck size just by having your individual cards be broken.

Champ has slightly more exhaust than an average character, and headbutt. That's not enough to make champ feel very inconsistent, and a lot worse when you don't find mommy of truth. It can get you out of a bind, scale you faster, and helps with champ's horrible draw every turn due to retain/
what I'm trying to say is that champ's efficiency means he needs far less help then other characters do.

Which I'd say is an issue. A lack if deck manipulation and draw and deck thinning, and a struggle for long term scaling leads to the state champ currently is in. Can chew through act 1 without a problem and has so much abundant burst damage, but struggles a ton in the late game when he can't just 1 tap things and actually needs to interact with the enemy

and extremely susceptible to poor draws, you only have 5 cards in your hand and he has no draw powers, so you can often just find yourself in a situation where you eat 60 damage against repto despite steamrolling literally the whole game and die from full hp in 1 fight.
Champ has pretty bad matchups against all 3 act 3 elites (a lack of consistent draw/damage can really suck against repto and nemesis, and champ often struggle to get through so much hp for head)
and can struggle against some of the act 3 fights, mostly IC3 and silent 3
a lot of these daily discussions make me think the trick to beating half of downfall is "pick up this one card and win"
and a lot against ||merchant boss||
btw what happens when you fight a20 merchant but you havent beaten the normal merchant yet during that run

Obviously it's not that simple (except for gem cannon, where it just is) for most of them, but often the cards to are described that way are very over-statted and more often than not simple and straightforward.
gem cannon, ghost shield, now this
I'd assume the same as fighting merchant in act 4 pre-hermit update (nothing)
Definitely a top champ card but I wouldn't put it up there with the list of run-defining cards.
game balance is hard
:mewhenthe:
oh yeah definitely, it's just weird to see some cards go unchanged. I understand they probably plan on reworking them soon, but at least for now a slight number decrease would be appreciated.
Like none of hexa's big ~~3~~4 common cards were nerfed last update.
I could see why sword of night wasn't changed (nerfing the best attack while introducing a vulnerable source on a character who primarily deals damage through debuffs would be weird)
but shield of night would be fine blocking 1-2 less
<shield of night>

messages.content: nothing, the fight just happens as normal
if you win you don't get souls though

champ is fine into nemesis, its really only reptomancer that could be a problem. Because funny 70 damage turn two can kill you if your opening hand is bad thats not even really a champ thing thats just reptomancer being stupid like defect dies in that fight 10x more often then champ does.

whats wrong with champs scaling though, i've had little issues late game as champ. he has great block, built in strength scaling, several powers that increase your counter/vigor gain, a dozen attacks you can build your whole deck around and two get out of jail free cards (ignore pain and cheap shot)
Champ really isn't. Those burns HURT, and between the burns and low draw it means you can just skip a damage turn against it due to not having any attacks.
Champ can semi-consistently throw up like 20 block, but struggles doing anything more unless you use the blur card.

ya the blur card is pretty good, but how are you only getting 20 block. All of his block cards have normal numbers and hes getting free block from defensive stance just from playing the game he has 2 dexterity powers for long fights and he has <backstep> one of the best common blocks in the whole mod.
